bit longer and but ultimately the end goal is working in an optimized state in

has anybody heard of the CAF out in the audience today a few the CAF is the
cloud adoption framework and what that is it's a project planning framework that has also been developed by working
with our customers at AWS over the years it's divided into six different perspectives each one of these
perspectives gives detailed guidance on how an organization can handle and manage that change during a cloud
migration these are divided and the reason you see the two colors represented here three perspectives that
deal with more of the business functions of the cloud and then three perspectives that deal more with the technical or
operations function of a cloud migration so as we look at business people and governance those are the ones that you
need to really do as a foundational exercise to make sure that you're properly budgeting that you have a
skills assessment that you know how you're going to utilize your people to make the transition and that you have a governance model established then as you

some seed funding we'll commercialize it we'll make a company out of it called Helio campus and you take it out to

right way for them so we wanted to make sure that we understand these key challenges and having an Arctic

it really starts with we call it an analysis agenda where we want to understand what are those challenges
that you're trying to solve and the way that we approach that is that we replicate source data systems inside
Amazon Web Services we use the redshift data warehouse environment and then we also load on the on the end we see data
visualizations we load the BI tools directly into Amazon Web service as well so we have a secure platform that's
performant that we're able to ingest any number of data sources regardless of
what the sources whether it's on premise or another cloud system and the idea is that we have a central point
of truth we have a central repository we're able to centralize all the data so
that whether we're bringing in existing source system so Student Information Systems or ERP that is called in the
